quoteLast: the four monitors composing the right wing of the fleet are all engaged, each pressing on to reach the northeastern face of the fort, where the wall is weakest, each receiving as they arrive at particular points a terrible fire, seemingly from all points of the compass,--points selected by trial and practice indicated by buoys.
title:
The Boys of '61
or, Four Years of Fighting, Personal Observations with the Army and Navy
author: Coffin, Charles Carleton, 1823-1896

quoteFirst: The Nottingham roughs, who were in great force, made an invasion, and drove all back who would not buy Nottingham tickets. Spring, who had provided tickets for the London men, had not yet arrived. At
quoteLast: the men entered the ring――Caunt first, attended by Molyneux the Black and Jem Turner as seconds, Butler having charge of the bottles. Bendigo was attended by Nick Ward and Jack Hannan, Jem Ward and Jem Burn. They shook hands, and tossed for choice of corners.
title:
Pugilistica: The History of British Boxing, Volume 3 (of 3)
Containing Lives of the Most Celebrated Pugilists; Full Reports of Their Battles from Contemporary Newspapers, With Authentic Portraits, Personal Anecdotes, and Sketches of the Principal Patrons of the Prize Ring, Forming a Complete History of the Ring from Fig and Broughton, 1719-40, to the Last Championship Battle Between King and Heenan, in December 1863
author: Miles, Henry Downes, 1806-1889

quoteFirst: "Your telegram received.  If it is official I decline to answer.  _Entre nous_ I will be thirty-one on the 29th of February at something like
quoteLast: in the morning—they didn’t have a stopwatch in the house.  I vote in Cherokee County, Pacolet precinct, generally of late in a cigar-box in the shed-room of Jake Sims’s store where Gus Herndon used to run a barber-shop when you and I were young, Maggie.
title: The Call of the South
author: Durham, Robert Lee, 1870-1949; Roth, Henry [Illustrator]

quoteLast: -- The reason being for this, it might be said, That things in death were neither clocks nor people, but only dead.

quoteFirst: A falling shower had soaked the crowd, but they had not withdrawn a step. Rasseneur's dog had begun to bark again. And it was at
quoteLast: only that the first shock was felt. The Voreux trembled, but continued solid and upright.
title: Germinal

quoteFirst: It lasts under ten minutes, so that he has not much time for observing, but no doubt time enough for his purpose. The rest of the day we have the usual artillery duels, rather heavier than usual, and at
quoteLast: , and again at five, we have our usual shelling by our old friend “Whistling Rufus.”
title: Gallipoli Diary

quoteFirst: "But see here," said M. Plantat, "it was the odd hour marked by that clock that struck me. The hands point to
quoteLast: ; yet we know that the countess was fully dressed, when she was struck. Was she up taking tea at three in the morning? It's hardly probable.
title: The Mystery of Orcival
author: Gaboriau, Emile, 1832-1873
